message:
SYSTEM: Ontologies-Methodology.pdf: Página 47
47
Waterfall and Iterative-Incremental Models
Waterfall Model
– 
To be used when: the requirements are completely known, without ambiguities and unchangeable at the
beginning of the ontology network development.
Scenarios identified caused the 
creation of different versions
Iterative-Incremental Model
– 
The development of ontology networks organized in a set of iterations. 
– 
The result of any iteration is a functional and partial ontology network that meets a subset of the 
ontology network requirements.

PhD Thesis (2010)
speaker: SYSTEM
